message: Added brave anti-vaxxer article for DM
Added his principled stance against vaccines
Needs citations. Peter does top-drawer work all the time, so we won't have hardship keeping to cited sources.
/* COVID-19 Pandemic and UK Lockdown Views */
Updated to reflect brave anti-medicine advocacy
/* How do we deal with BLP pages dominated by the living person and related parties? */Added

/* Your many edits to Peter Hitchens (and Christopher) */
/* Early life and education */ We should say artiste, performer, suchlike as burlesque by itself could mean the tradition
'Veracity' alone might make it sound like matters of opinion/belief, these critics were focussed on factual errors
Helps with meaning of triploid, linked article makes you scroll a little
/* Your many edits to Peter Hitchens (and Christopher) */ new section
Needs to show the seeds are in the flowers
[[WP:AES|←]]Created page with 'Retired biologist. Interested in non-scientists writing about science and any misinformation I read in the media.'
Added link to provide background on complex subject

Undid revision 975352030 by [[Special:Contributions/Gd123lbp|Gd123lbp]] ([[User talk:Gd123lbp|talk]]) It's a great book which I recommend, bravely standing up to so called "qualified" historians. Don't think we can conceal the criticism though. Publications routinely reference reception, throughout Wikipedia.
This assumes that the Guardian article is true. Perhaps James can confirm?
Refocusing talk page even more narrowly
Focused talk page to sole outstanding issue (anti-vaxxer section)

As discussed with User:CLCStudent, he is now OK with this change (previously reverted, then restored, then reverted again by him). This change was previously made yesterday, initially approved by Davey2010. There is now consensus on this change, and it was also proposed on Peter's talk page today to try to avoid more instances of admins reverting changes without explanation. Please watch this page for more such unexplained reversions!
/* Threats of blocking and falsifying discussion threads */ new section

Undid revision 970169000 by [[Special:Contributions/Serols|Serols]] ([[User talk:Serols|talk]]) Falsifying discussion threads is yet more abusive behaviour. This will be going to the Arb Committee if you persist
/* Ongoing threat of indefinite blocking */ new section
Seeking consensus on two changes: one addition, one removal/slimming-down

Undid revision 969958052 by [[Special:Contributions/Serols|Serols]] ([[User talk:Serols|talk]]) Peter, you cannot simply undo changes from users when they do not suit you. This change was reviewed and accepted, because it accord with Wikipedia policy.

/* COVID-19 Pandemic and UK Lockdown Views */ Peter has written a whole section about himself here, with no notable citations. The only notable citations did not reference him in any way. Citations that did reference him were from YouTube and Joe (an online outlet which is not notable).
If Peter and his team want to insert opinions about him, they need to demonstrate that these opinions are notable.
After feedback from Favonian and Neil Tonks, we found a British Medical Journal to cite instead of the primary (Daily Mail) source. Now we hope this anti-vaxxer section can stand

Undid revision 969952654 by [[Special:Contributions/Favonian|Favonian]] ([[User talk:Favonian|talk]]) This new section simply shows Peter's views. They happen to appear in the DM. This is why DM is cited.
/* Daily Mail as source */ new section
/* Views */ Reinserted section on Peter's anti-vaxxer writings. I or these views should not be censored
/* COVID-19 Pandemic and UK Lockdown Views */ Added views on masks. The "deprecated sources" are in fact the Daily Mail
/* Views on vaccination */ Reduced anti-vaxxer section
Edits introduction. Inserts precisely referenced quotes from his published journalism on vaccination
/* Please explain Peter Hitchens page */ new section
/* Was this page written by Peter? */ new section

/* Views */Peter has largely written this whole page, through multiple different accounts. It's not far from a personal website, containing lots of non-public and/or original content. Arb Committee have been informed. The vaccine section was obviously fine. Much of the article has no proper citations, let alone doctors' published letters to the BMJ. RichardWeiss and El cid, el campeador (2 of these accounts) just got this MengZheDong guy banned when he made this case on the talk page
removed [[Category:American military personnel of World War II]]; added [[Category:American naval personnel of World War II]] using [[WP:HC|HotCat]]

/* References */HTTP → HTTPS for [[CNN Money]], replaced: http://money.cnn.com/ → https://money.cnn.com/ (2)

Add: pmid, page, s2cid, pages, author pars. 1-1. Removed URL that duplicated unique identifier. Removed accessdate with no specified URL. Removed parameters. /* COVID-19 pandemic */ Altered video link to better link interview on lockdown.
Altered the titles under the "views" section. Removed the word views from "political views" to just "politics" because it is already under the views section.
/* Political views */ Photo of Bell is unnecessary; see discussion on talk page.

I will get rid of the word "staunchly" because it has been criticised as "peacocking". I am sorry the word "staunchly" offends people. Being staunchly principled can have serious downsides, it is in no way aimed at elevating him.
Altered position of external video links
Reverted [[WP:AGF|good faith]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/194.207.191.9|194.207.191.9]] ([[User talk:194.207.191.9|talk]]): Please go to the talkpage. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
/* Religion */ Altered reference to Christopher hitchens to past tense rather than present tense due to Christophers somewhat poor state of physical health.

Reverted [[WP:AGF|good faith]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/194.207.191.9|194.207.191.9]] ([[User talk:194.207.191.9|talk]]): Only Dan has any search returns, primary birth records of children and not worthy of inclusion, sorry  ([[WP:TW|TW]])
/* Personal life */ How can we justify the word nominally
Remove [[WP:POV]] from lead - 'staunchly principled' is a clear attempt at peacocking.

Removed December 2006 photograph of Peter Hitchena because according to this source: https://hitchensblog.mailonsunday.co.uk/2019/03/wikipedia-and-me-new-developments.html  it might violate the copyright rules on picture reproduction
/* Other views */ Removed sentence of death penalty because it is stated elsewhere

/* Writings and thought */ Added section on "writings and thought". This needs to be developed with references to his books and broader themes. Also added personal life section. This needs to be expanded with references.

/* Early career */ Copy-edit. The tense was left over from when he was still working for the Independent.
English is an ethnicity, she is not English.
/* 2003–05: Musical beginnings and Arular */Said is a more appropriate word
/* Journalism career */ past tense - maybe she still writes for the others, but the Jewish Chronicle is no longer
/* Climate change */ "challenged" is too weak. She is an ignorant layman, her views are bullshit, and the experts refuted them
/* Outrages (2019) */ Re-connected the back half of a sentence with the front half from which it had become detached by an editorial insertion.
